name: Dreepy
flavorText: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesn't feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.

name: Drakloak

flavorText: This Pokémon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until they're all grown up.

name: Dragapult ex

Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Latias ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

name: Moltres

abilities.name: Flare Float

flavorText: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They're jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

name: Toedscruel

attacks.name: Eerie Tentacles

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

abilities.name: Flower Curtain

name: Toedscool

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Klefki

abilities.name: Mischievous Lock
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities, except for Mischievous Lock.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.

name: Rellor

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

name: Rabsca

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Lisia's Appeal
rules: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot. If you do, the new Active Pokémon is now Confused.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Venture Bomb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on your Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Team Rocket's Transceiver
rules: Search your deck for a Supporter card that has "Team Rocket" in its name, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Blowtorch
rules: You can use this card only if you discard a Basic Fire Energy card from your hand.  Discard a Pokémon Tool or Special Energy card from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon, or discard a Stadium in play.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Therapeutic Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.The Pokémon this card is attached to recovers from being Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed and can't be affected by those Special Conditions.

name: N's Zoroark ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Trade
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Night Joker
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched N's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Powerful Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Back Draft
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Basic Energy card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Flamebody Cannon
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cleffa

attacks.name: Grasping Draw
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

flavorText: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

name: Okidogi ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Poisonous Musculature
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Darkness Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, this Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Chain-Crazed
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 130 more damage.

name: Toedscool

attacks.name: Furious Kicks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Gastly
flavorText: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

name: Mega Gengar ex
rules: Mega Evolution ex Rule: When your Mega Evolution Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shadowy Concealment
abilities.text: If 1 of your Darkness Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon ex, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card. The effect of Shadowy Concealment doesn't stack.

attacks.name: Void Gale
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: N's PP Up
rules: Attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched N's Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: N's Castle
rules: N's Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Retreat Cost.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Powerglass
rules: At the end of your turn (after your attack), if the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot, you may attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to it.
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Binding Mochi
rules: Attacks used by the Poisoned Pokémon this card is attached to do 40 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: Janine's Secret Art
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Darkness Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Darkness Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you attached Energy to your Active Pokémon in this way, it is now Poisoned.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Rigid Band
rules: The Stage 1 Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

name: N's Plan
rules: Move up to 2 Energy from your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Reversal Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to an Evolution Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes), this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 3 Energy at a time.

name: Flareon ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Burning Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Carnelian
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Eevee ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Rainbow DNA
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve into any Pokémon ex that evolves from Eevee if you play it from your hand onto this Pokémon. (This Pokémon can't evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.)

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

name: Leafeon ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Verdant Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Moss Agate
attacks.text: Heal 100 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Cheer Up
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

name: Sylveon ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Magical Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon do 100 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Angelite
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Shuffle those Pokémon and all attached cards into your opponent's deck. If 1 of your Pokémon used Angelite during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

name: Froakie

attacks.name: Try Bouncing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Greninja ex
rules: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Shinobi Blade
attacks.text: You may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Mirage Barrage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
